Brazil: Field Marshal Deodoro da Fonseca organizes a military coup which deposes Emperor Pedro II of Brazil and abolishes the Brazilian monarchy. Deodoro da Fonseca proclaims Brazil a Republic and forms a Provisional Government.
The Brazilian Imperial Family is forced into exile in France.
The modern-day flag of Brazil is adopted by the Provisional Government of the Republic.
Argentina is the first country to recognize the abolition of the monarchy in Brazil.
